item.title: Test
item.description: Binomial Coefficient # The binomial coefficient $\binom{n}{k}$ equals the number of ways we can choose k elements from array of n elements. For example: $\binom{5}{3} = 10$ , because the set {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} has 10 subsets of 3 elements: {1, 2, 3}, {1, 2, 4}, {1, 2, 5}, {1, 3, 4}, {1, 3, 5}, {1, 4, 5}, {2, 3, 4}, {2, 3, 5}, {2, 4, 5}, {3, 4, 5}
